Name: Funerary stela
Description: This stela in limestone shows the deceased and his wife  before an offering table. The scene is surrounded by a frame in a black, red, yellow and white check pattern. The hieroglyphs written on one line above the people and in two columns behind the offering table are nearly entirely effaced. This type of monument is very characteristc of a category of stelae which come from the necropolis of Naga-ed-Deir and which date from the 1st Intermediate Period.
